page.title: 04CHEBSEY
page.content: Chebsey is a quiet hamlet, tucked away from main road traffic, and dominated by its large church. The hamlet never reached its destiny as a centre of communication, unlike Eccleshall which has a similarly large church. There are 2 farms in Chebsey, 2 old houses, 6 council houses (4 of which are now privately owned), a few attractive houses with well-kept gardens, plus one modern house (although Chebsey is a conservation area and special regulations apply). The old village school is now used as a community centre, and about half of the population are involved in social activities that focus on the church.
